intro: Burmeistera marginata, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are slender and branching. Burmeistera marginata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
